intro: Costus vaginalis, commonly known as the white costus, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa, Asia, and Australia. It belongs to the Zingiberaceae family, which includes gingers and related plants. The plant features tall, leafy stems with narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, clustered white or pale yellow flowers. Its rhizomes are often used in traditional medicine for their purported anti-inflammatory and antimicrobial properties. The botanical characteristics of Costus vaginalis make it an ornamental plant valued for its striking foliage and fragrant blooms.
